meanings.definition: A state of excessive excitement or stimulation.
meanings.sent1: The hyperexcitements of the children at the birthday party were contagious.
meanings.sent2: She couldn't contain her hyperexcitements when she won the game.
meanings.sent3: The hyperexcitements of the puppy chasing its tail were adorable to watch.
meanings.sent4: The hyperexcitements of the crowd reached a fever pitch as the band took the stage.
meanings.sent5: The hyperexcitements of the students before the school dance were palpable in the air.

meanings.definition: The act of becoming overly excited or stimulated.
meanings.sent1: His hyperexcitements over the upcoming vacation were hard to ignore.
meanings.sent2: After the announcement, the hyperexcitements in the room were palpable.
meanings.sent3: The hyperexcitements of the squirrel gathering nuts were quite amusing to observe.
meanings.sent4: The hyperexcitements of the child on Christmas morning were like a whirlwind of joy.
meanings.sent5: The hyperexcitements of the fans filled the stadium with energy and anticipation.
